item.title: GoGLL: General Context-free Parsing Made Easy
item.author: goccmack@gmail.com (Marius Ackerman)
item.description: Generalised LL (GLL) parsing is a practical technique of parsing general context-free grammars. Gogll is an open source compiler kit that generates a GLL parser and a finite state automaton (FSA) based lexer for any context-free grammar. What is GLL? Generalised LL (GLL) parsing [Scott 2010,2012] is a parsing technique that that can handle any context-free grammar. It parses from left to right and produces a parse forest containing all valid parse trees.
